| HistoryText             = 
===Origin===
With an increasing student body, [[Scott Summers (Earth-616)|Cyclops]] and [[Emma Frost (Earth-616)|Emma Frost]] reorganized the [[Xavier's School for Gifted Youngsters|Xavier Institute]]'s educational and training programs into a squad system.{{r|New X-Men Vol 2 #1}} The Alpha Squadron was originally advised by [[Jean-Paul Beaubier (Earth-616)|Northstar]],{{r|New X-Men Vol 2 #4}}{{r|New X-Men Vol 2 #13}} and later advised by [[Xi'an Coy Manh (Earth-616)|Karma]].{{r|New X-Men Vol 2 #14}}{{r|New X-Men: Academy X Yearbook #1}}

===Academy X===
When [[James Howlett (Earth-616)|Wolverine]] was brainwashed by [[Hydra (Earth-616)|Hydra]] he attacked the [[X-Men (Earth-616)|X-Men]] and the Xavier Institute and Northstar was among the X-Men to respond. Unfortunately, he was killed by Wolverine. Due to this loss, the Squad was assigned Karma as a new adviser.{{r|New X-Men Vol 2 #13|#14}}

===Members===
* [[Victor Borkowski (Earth-616)|Anole]] - Victor Borkowski has a reptilian mutation. Field Leader. Retained his powers and remained with the X-Men.
* [[Paras Gavaskar (Earth-616)|Indra]] - Paras Gavaskar is a young boy from [[India]] able to extend exoskeletal armor plates over his body. Retained his powers and remained with the X-Men.
* [[Lazaro Kotikash (Earth-616)|Kidogo]] - Lazaro Kotikash is a Maasai who could shrink himself down to 4 inches in height. Depowered, and current whereabouts/status unknown.
* [[Alani Ryan (Earth-616)|Loa]]- Alani Ryan is a [[Hawaii (State)|Hawaiian]] girl who can "swim" through solid matter, causing it to crumble around her as she does so. Retained her powers and remained with the X-Men.
* [[Sarah Vale (Earth-616)|Network]] - Sarah Vale's power was cyberpathy. Depowered, and killed in bus bombing by the [[Purifiers (Earth-616)|Purifiers]].{{r|New X-Men Vol 2 #24}}  
* [[Andrea Margulies (Earth-616)|Rubber Maid]] - Andrea Margulies was able to stretch any portion of her body due to her ultra-elasticity. She  was the youngest member of the Squad. Depowered, and killed in bus bombing by the [[Purifiers (Earth-616)|Purifiers]].{{r|New X-Men Vol 2 #24}} 

===M-Day===
After [[Decimation|M-Day]] only 27 of 182 enrolled Xavier's students retained their powers. The Alpha Squadron was disbanded along with all the other [[X-Men Training Squads (Earth-616)|X-Men Training Squads]].{{r|New X-Men Vol 2 #20|#23}}  

| Equipment               = 
| Transportation          = 
| Weapons                 = Each teammates' arsenal

| Notes                   = 

| Trivia                  = 
* The squad was named after [[Alpha Flight (Earth-616)|Alpha Flight]] to which the original adviser, [[Jean-Paul Beaubier (Earth-616)|Northstar]], belonged. 
* This squad’s colors were black and light blue/grey with red accents.
